title: El Camino Real de los Tejas National Historic Trail: McKinney Falls State Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     A Photographic Journey of the Trail     A Photographic Journey - Pictures 16-30     McKinney Falls State Park                  McKinney Falls State Park        Christopher Talbot       McKinney Falls State Park, Travis County, Texas Father Isidro Félix Esty Espinosa, with the Olivares-Aguirre expedition, first described the arroyo/río de las Garrapatas (present-day Onion Creek) in 1709. Recent research reveals that in 1716 the expedition of Domingo Ramón followed the left bank of Onion Creek along the western edge of McKinney Falls State Park to its junction with Williamson Creek. Current images clearly document the rock indentations that resulted from extensive use of the area. Time period: 1700–1800s Ownership: Public (Texas Parks and Wildlife Department) A Photographic Journey of the Trail - NEXT IMAGE PREVIOUS IMAGE
